2. Row 2: Stan Jones won the Victorian Trophy Race at Fisherman's Bend. Just one win again.

7. Row 7: Lex Davison won the Australian Grand Prix at Mount Panorama Circuit. One win.
8. Row 8: Stirring Moss won the Melbourne Grand Prix at Albert Park. Single win.
9. Row 9: Stan Jones won the Phillip Island Trophy Race at Phillip Island Grand Prix Circuit. He has now two wins on this circuit (rows 2 and 9).

From this, I see that Alec Mildren has two wins at Lowood Circuit (rows 5 and 6), which supports the claim in part. However, Stan Jones also has two wins, one at Fisherman's Bend (row 2) and another at Phillip Island (row 9). So, there are multiple drivers with two wins on the same circuit.

Therefore, the claim that "the only drive to win both races on the same circuit be Alec Mildren" is false because Stan Jones also did this. Additionally, I should note which rows and columns are relevant for verification. The relevant cells would be the ones where a driver has won multiple races on the same circuit.

The claim is false because both Alec Mildren and Stan Jones have each won two races at the same circuits (Lowood Circuit and Phillip Island Grand Prix Circuit, respectively).
